On march 16, 2013
Draink
Draink

What was he thinking? That mess he caused back there had ruined his reputation, the whole camp had witnessed it. Draink sped past the trees, damning himself for what he did.

Draink spat, resting his shoulder on a tree, looking at its leaves. God damn it. It was sunny and cold, his lips stuck together. There was an itching feeling it his gut, a feeling he wanted to end. Kill.

"Me, me, me.. oh." He looked at the gun, reminding himself of why he came here for.

Grunnnghrrr.

Draink shot back into reality, crouching by the tree and peeking out from behind it. The rotter, unsurprisingly, was straight ahead. Great, another distraction.

Draink got up, calmly unlatching the hatchet and holding it to his thigh. Draink felt his urge to pummel the man, but his arms never went up.

Draink took a breath. His stomach churned, making him cringe. He looked at the hatchet, not moving and staying still in his hands. He was numbly paralyzed as the man's yellow, grim nails.

Do it, come on. Get it over with. Do it, you wimp.

"Shut up!" He shut his eyes.

The feeling oozed out of him, painfully burning his mind. His head began to ache, the blood in his head pounding.

He opened his eyes, finding a familiar, yet not so much familiar, face staring with milky white eyes at him.

Willy. The man he tossed around. Draink recognized the marks and gashes on his face. He took a step back, leaving the hatchet buried into his scalp. Willy gurgled like a backed up toilet, then smoothly moaned as he collapsed.


He bent over, finding himself throwing up. "I hate you.. I hate you." Draink repeated, wiping his mouth and taking back the hatchet. "You hear me? Do you freakin' hear me you son of a bitch !" Draink kicked Willy, shouting in the sky. "You're no good. Nothing about you is, so damn you."

Draink slid the hatchet into his hands, moving towards the railway ahead. A sign read GREENPORT CROSSING - TRAIN STATION. The sign was rusted and bent, the first building behind it resembling a burnt out house.

The motel.

Draink walked past it, cutting the corner to see the train station's rest stop and diner. He unwillingly walked to the diner, covering his face with an arm as he rolled inside.

The stench hit him like a fist, smacking the air out of him. The place was filled with the boiling corpses of the customers awaiting their orders. Nothing he could use.

Voice
"Its a man!
Voice 2
"Hey, cut it out Tracy. Get the baby back."
Draink

Draink jerked back, glaring back at the pack of teens that stood huddled together by the railroads. Before he could react, the young, male teen who had spoken raised a wooden baseball bat.

Then the baby in Tracy's arms shrieked.

Draink

Draink froze, watching the teenager with ruffled brown hair make his move. The teen was lanky and had acne on his face. The teen was pushing back the scared girl with the baby in a bundle of rags in her arms.

Draink closed the door behind him slowly, keeping stern eye contact with the teen as he observed Draink. Draink shut the door and glanced at the other two youths.

One of them had short, curly red hair and held a shower curtain rod with an uneasy look on his face and wore football knee pads and bulky chest pads. The other kid had the chest pads under his shirt and a football helmet and positioned a baseball bat with nails dug into it on his chest.

On march 18, 2013
065tdsa

65After meeting back with Anne and Silent, and catching up on what had been going on while him and the others were gone, 65 had been thinking about what to do next.
After a while he thought that they might as well go find Draink. Should have never let that guy go alone in the first place... And if he actually finds something of worth he might need help to carry it...

That's what he thought, although the truth was that his motivation was mere boredom, and boredom's bad for the troops, everyone knows that.

"Guys, come on, we are leaving!" he told them, while he picked up his machete, "We are going to go see what's up with Draink, before he gets lost, eaten or something..."

"I'm going with you!" Anne said as she stepped forward.

"No you aren't, this place's-" 65 started saying, but Anne interrupted him.

"Safe?" Anne asked ironically "Yeah sure, it's not like we almost got killed here, and twice! I am going."

"Fine, but you'll be useful..." 65 said, and then started looking through the weapons that they had from the soldiers. "Heh, look at this thing!" he said after a while, taking a pocket knife out of the bunch of weapons.

"Now, for a soldier, this is a real joke! But it'll do for you..." he said, handing it over to Anne "Remember, only poke other people's eyes out, not yours, got it?"

"Yeah, i guessed so..." Anne answered him. After that, they went out and got going.
On march 18, 2013
Draink

DrainkDraink watched them leave, their figures blending into the shadowy glare of the rising sun. Draink pondered: why would kids be living in a sewer? Then realization hit him. There was no safe place.

Draink went to the train station store, walking inside without hesitation. He expected what he saw, dead customers and a walking cashier slumped over a motionless, fleshless body.

The cashier snapped its head back, sneering and slowly lifting its hunched back. Draink sent the rotter down with a single blow from the hatchet.

He looked over the shelves, items littered on the floor with bodies sprawled all over. Draink scanned the shelves, flying past the chocolate bars and tossing the intact ones inside his pockets.

He never liked Fudgebars or CrunchyCoco bars. He threw his hands at the shelves, digging in to find his prized goal. Malteasers.

The red and gold wrapper was no where in site. He went over to the meats and fish aisle, then regretting his decision as the stench of rotting food and the sight of crouched rotters scrambling into meat coolers and ripping the plastic off with their teeth.

Holy..

Draink took a step back.

1-50 = Spotted
51-100 = Not spotted.
67
On march 18, 2013
Draink

DrainkDraink fell back into the first aisle, holding his breath as the rotters continued their feast on the endless supply of fish and meat.

He traced his fingers on the gun and slid it out, trying to calm himself with a few breaths of the foggy, pungent air. He stood up from his position and went to get drinks.

"Of course." He said, finding the water price tags but no water.
On march 18, 2013
Coldflame

James started to take off his suit. He was going to need to move quickly, flexibly, and without being impaired. He put on his Flak vest.
JamesThis is it. It isn't going to be easy. Contact Draink. We need to do this now. Things are getting worse and worse by the second.

Cutting some material from his ruined suit, James fastened a bandanna around his head to keep his hair in check. Of course it wasn't to feel cool. Of course it wasn't.

James slide a pistol and a few clips onto his belt. His shotgun went into one of the slots on the vest.

JamesStakes are high. We can't fuck this up. How are you for ammo? I have 10 Shells left, two pistol clips. The rifle has 5 clips.

MrCreeper

Off: Nice teleporting 65
Jonas sighed and thinked of his life... Was this what he was supposed to be, A blood thirsty ghoul that is going to eventualy kill everyone and eat them? Then he thought was it really worth living? He said Nope.avi in his mind and sighed once again. He took his stuff, Walked out of the hut not caring about the others, He began walking south of the hut towards Greenport. He reached the outskirts of Greenport, Nothing. It was completely empty... Not even a zombie to make him happier. He breathed out, Grabbed his pistol and pointed it against his side and pulled the trigger.The gun cracked out and the pain exploded, falling to his knees and he quickly fell unconsious.

On march 25, 2013
Draink

LloydLloyd closed the manhole plate and jumped down from the ladder. He nodded at Arden, who escorted Tracy and her sister to the somewhat cozy perimeter. He signed, examining the area.

The wooden scrap and dumpsters formed a nice little home. Safer than above, he thought. Going to the entrance when a hand blocked him. "Armando?"

ArmandoArmando tore off the football helmet and scratched his sideburns. "I feel like a dumb robot wearing this, heh." He threw it into the perimeter of the zone, the helmet rolling in with multiple clanging sounds. "What are we going to do about that guy?"

Lloyd"Nothing," He said flatly, trying to walk into the shelter.

Armando"What do you mean, Lloyd? You mean you gonna wimp out or somethin'? These kids depend on you, and I ain't no sucker or an idiot to know that they do."

Then the sewage filled with quiet, still air as the loud cracking bounced off the walls from above.

On march 25, 2013
Coldflame

He looked to Jonas walking out.
JamesJonas...
He followed him loosely, until the single person he'd been able to trust pulled out a gun, pointed it at his head, and pulled the trigger.

It didn't even take five seconds.

A flash of crimson.

James gave up any hope of clearing the warehouse after that. He buried his former friend, considering following his example. For all of his morale lost by seeing that, he gained all of it and more back in determination and refusal to give up.

As he walked away from the blazing hut which he set alight so he could keep it behind him, James pressed the button on his radio.

JamesDraink.

Where's the beach camp you mentioned? It's about to have some changes.

On march 30, 2013
Draink

THE CHURCH

PhilipThe truck came to a close with a sputtering crackle in front of the church. He heard the front door open, Tyrone sprinting out with his bat, swinging it at the isolated individual undead.

"Let's go," Philip took the keys and jumped out of the truck, walking past Tyrone as came out, smashing the spikes of his baseball ball against the neck of one of the undead.

Philip rested the dry sub-machine gun around his shoulder, stepping into the chapel where there was no heavy set fog, embracing the warmth of the indoor fireplace where the parents and children were huddled together.

Anthony"Philip," Anthony stood shy-fully behind Adulfus, watching Philip turn. His face was uneasy. "Did you find anything?"

Philip"Nope." Philip smirked. Anthony asked for some thing, those people weren't something. They were housing Blant. He remembered the guy, tough guy. Stubborn. "People. Blant."

Anthony
"Blant?"

Adulfus"The non-believer!" Adulfus said, smiling crookedly.

TyroneTyrone rushed inside, locking the door. He was panting, sweating from head-to-toe. "Holy shit."

Philip"Whoa, hey!"Philip started walking to Tyrone, trying to help him. "Where's Tro-" He was cut off, his words never coming out as the muffled thumping arose from behind Tyrone.

BOOM!

The rapid booms and explosions rattled outside, followed by the hollow screaming of something. Someone. "Troy," Philip grabbed Tyrone, "what did you do!"

Tyrone"Don't! Don't go out, there's too many." Tyrone stammered.

PhilipHe looked down, noticing Tyrone was without his bat. "We can't. We can't just let him die."

AdulfusAdulfus listened. He listened to the growing moans and the deafening of Troy's pleas. "No. He'll be reborn."

PhilipPhilip turned. "That's horseshit! He's bein' ripped to shreds." Philip stopped as he saw the huddled residents starting to murmur. "Don't do this Henderson."

Adulfus"Its settled and now we settle down.

On may 2, 2013
hankolijo

Jackson StarJackson injected the first mixture in the first specimen.
It started releasing noises that could be classified as screaming.
Foam started coming from the mouth, the nose was bleeding heavily.
Then it stopped.
"A way to kill a zombie without damaging the brain directly. Interesting."
He took another needle, jabbing this one in the next specimens neck.
The blood turned green. The specimens skin began to bubble, boiling from the toxic mass that used to be blood.
The zombie kept going. Its skin was gone, green goop was dripping off of him.
It spat on Jacksons hazmat suit.
The suit managed to not get destroyed, but the capabilities of this serum were highly useful.
The final specimen.
This serum caused heavy growth on rats.
"I wonder what will this do..."

Name:Jackson stone.
The rest:IDK, he is wearing a hazmat suit, bro!

Draink

Because I feel like its time I'll post. Thanks for posting Hank, but remember! The origin of the 'disease' in Die2nite is unknown, same as here hehe.

Also;

My character is going to save Hank so far.

Draink

Draink couldn't move. The gunshot was still ringing in his ears. Ring. Ring. Like a doorbell. He shuddered, blinking twice, then again. James said something, the sound was muffled. The rifle in his hands fumbled in his hand, the plastic bag rattling with the jumble of items inside.

He should have done something to save Jonas. Jonas was infected with it, that disease or something. You saw it, Draink. Did you? What could you have done?

"What happened... no idea. What is happening..."
